    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Controller initialization method. Lambdas within this method make the code adding event listeners to various controls much more concise than had a ChangeListener class been directly implemented.

      • applyResources

        private void applyResources()
        Applies language resources from the ResourceBundle in the resources field to the appropriate labels and conrtols.

      • initializeAppointmentsTableColumns

        private void initializeAppointmentsTableColumns()
        Initializes appointmentsTable.

      • initializeCustomersTableColumns

        private void initializeCustomersTableColumns()
        Initializes the columns of the customersTable TableView and their values.

      • updateCustomersTable

        private void updateCustomersTable()
        Updates the customers in customersTable Table View.

      • getUpcomingAppointments

        private java.util.ArrayList<Appointment> getUpcomingAppointments()
        Filters the allAppointments field and returns the appointments set to start within 15 minutes of the current time. A lambda is used within this method in order to simplify the code necessary for implementing the Predicate functional interface used by the java.util.stream.filter method. The lambda takes one appointment argument and returns a boolean: true if the appointment is set to start within the next MINUTES_DIFFERENCE minutes, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        Arraylist of appointments set to start within 15 minutes.

      • displayUpcomingAppointments

        private void displayUpcomingAppointments()
        Shows an alert displaying upcoming appointments.

      • updateAppointments

        private void updateAppointments()
        Updates the allAppointments field to current database state.

      • updateAppointmentsTable

        private void updateAppointmentsTable()
        Updates the data in appointmentsTable Table View.

      • setAppointmentFilters

        private void setAppointmentFilters​(java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                   java.time.LocalDate endDate)
        Filters the appointmentsTable Table View according to the selected filter method: by month or week. A lambda within this method takes the place of a Predicate interface implementation and is used by the FilteredList constructor to create a FilteredList from the allAppointments field containing only those appointments within the current filtered month/week being displayed. This FilteredList becomes the content of the appointmentsTable TableView.
        Parameters:
        startDate - the date from which to begin displaying appointments.
        endDate - the latest date up to which appointments should be shown.

      • showPreviousFilteredAppointments

        public void showPreviousFilteredAppointments()
        Changes data in the appointmentsTable Table View to display the previous month or week's appointments depending on the filter currently applied to the appointmentsTable.

      • showNextFilteredAppointments

        public void showNextFilteredAppointments()
        Changes data in the appointmentsTable Table View to display the next month or week's appointments depending on the filter currently applied to the appointmentsTable.

      • updateTabs

        private void updateTabs​(javafx.scene.control.Tab selectedTab)
        Changes various controls' actions depending on selectedTab. If the customersTab is currently being viewed, the add, modify, and delete buttons will operate on customer data. If the appointmentsTab is currently being viewed, the add, modify, and delete buttons will operate on appointment data. If a tab other than these is selected, the add, modify, and delete buttons will disappear. Lambdas are used within this method allowing single line statements for setting a control's action. This makes the code within more readable.
        Parameters:
        selectedTab - The tab that is now selected.

      • appointmentOperation

        private void appointmentOperation​(java.lang.Integer appointmentId)
        Launches a new window with a form to add a new appointment or update an existing appointment.
        Parameters:
        appointmentId - The appointment ID of an appointment to be modified or null if a new appointment is to be added.

      • modifyAppointment

        private void modifyAppointment()
        Obtains selected appointment from appointmentsTable and allows user to modify data in this appointment.

      • deleteAppointment

        private void deleteAppointment()
        Obtains selected appointment from appointmentsTable and attempts to delete the appointment from the database. An alert is shown to report the status of the delete.

      • addAppointment

        private void addAppointment()
        Displays a new window with a form for adding new appointments.

      • confirmDelete

        private java.lang.Boolean confirmDelete()
        Displays a confirmation alert to confirm the deletion of a customer or appointment.
        Returns:
        true if user clicks OK, false if user clicks Cancel for the confirmation alert.

      • customerOperation

        private void customerOperation​(java.lang.Integer customerId)
        Launches a new window with a form to add a new customer or update an existing customer.
        Parameters:
        customerId - The customer ID of a customer to be modified or null if a new customer is to be added.

      • addCustomer

        public void addCustomer()
        Opens a window with a form for adding new customers.

      • modifyCustomer

        private void modifyCustomer()
        Obtains selected customer from customersTable and allows user to modify the data for this customer.

      • deleteCustomer

        private void deleteCustomer()
        Obtains selected customer from customerTable and allows user to delete this customer. An alert notifies user of the deletion operation's success or failure.

      • generateReport

        public void generateReport()
        Clears the currently displayed reports from the reportsDisplay VBox and then generates a new report depending on the user's report type selection using radioButtons.

      • clearReports

        private void clearReports()
        Clears the reportsDisplay VBox.

      • displayContactSchedules

        private void displayContactSchedules()
        Displays the schedule of each company contact in the reportsDisplayVBox

      • displayMonthTypeReport

        private void displayMonthTypeReport()
        Displays a report of appointment count by month and type in the reportsDisplay VBox.

      • monthTypeReport

        private java.util.HashMap<java.time.LocalDate,​java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Map>> monthTypeReport()
        Generates a report of appointment counts by month and type
        Returns:
        a HashMap containing the appointment counts by month and type.

      • displayContactCustomerInteraction

        private void displayContactCustomerInteraction​(int contactId)
        Generates a report on a selected contact based on their customer appointment data
        Parameters:
        contactId - the contact ID of the contact whose customer interaction is being displayed.
